data.title: Neshoba Ancestors that served in Regiments other than Neshoba Regiments (Misc. Reg.)
data.text:
If you have any corrections or additions, please e-mail Marsha. These are Civil War Entries only.

Adkins, Jefferson MarionÂ

b. Jul 3, 1838

36th MS Reg. Co. D

Organized at Union, MSÂ Feb 22, 1862 under Captain J. S. Tatum, and mustered into theÂ Regiment at Meridian MS.

Howard G. Adkins

Allday, John (aka John Aglaly)

born October 14, 1841 died Febuary 6, 1919. He served in the 46th Infantry Company K. His captain was Captain McDonald. He also served in the Wise Legion Company F. According to his military paperwork he was born in Monroe County, TN.

Lisa Sandling

Bassett, Cristopher Columbus

36th MS Inf., Co. F

Pvt. Enlisted 5 March 1862 at Reinzi, Mississippi. Died of disease on 21 June 1862 in Northern MS. while serving.Â

Joe Coston

Pvt.,Â Enlisted 8 June 1861 and was surrendered on 4 May 1865 at

Citronelle, Alabama.

State Calvary, Corporal Perrin's Cavalry.Â The 11th was organized in the Spring of 1864 by the increase of Perrin's Cavalry, under Col. Robert O. Perrin, and surrendered April 26, 1865

Musgrove, LoveberryÂ ( b 1836 SC d. 1864) CSA asÂ a POW at CampÂ Douglas. HeÂ served in theÂ 40th Ms. InfantryÂ Regiment, Company G (Dixie Rangers raised inÂ Leake County), although heÂ wasÂ fromÂ NeshobaÂ County. HeÂ canÂ beÂ found inÂ severalÂ censusesÂ from the 1800's. HeÂ wasÂ marriedÂ toÂ CaledoniaÂ Parker ofÂ Philadelphia, Neshoba.

Aleta Todisco
